topic.title: Technological unemployment will force humanity to rethink its economic system
topic.body: What are your thoughts on this?

topic.title: Encryption and the bad guys
topic.body: I propose a discussion to raise arguments as to why strong encryption should be the standard even though it _could_ diminish law enforcement's power to catch so-called bad guys.

topic.title: What do you think about piracy/copying/stealing/sharing?
What would you do if you could not die of old age?
topic.body: and/or age-related diseases if you're picky.

topic.title: What browser do you use? Why?

1_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr.body:
> [nippletwister](#comment_4_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): You all probably have seen it, but anyway) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Pq-S557XQU

If you (or anyone reading) are interested in science fiction, I highly recommend [Accelerando](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accelerando) by Charles Stross. It's available free of cost on the author's [website](http://www.antipope.org/charlie/blog-static/fiction/accelerando/accelerando-intro.html).

2_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr.body: I claim that there aren't nearly enough "bad guys" to justify backdoors or any alternative that isn't strong cryptography.

> [cryptoguy](#comment_1_14H6RNueAm4HmAHjd3WEb4v9TeFEMthAZq): Strong cryptography is widely available as open source and can't be stopped by governments.

Agreed. Even if they did create a backdoored version, we would still have RSA and company.

2_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf.body: The parody is down. Here's a [mirror](https://vimeo.com/154401165) and [another](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-MyUi5U-SyM) version.

4_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr.body:
> [pycole](#comment_2_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): Get lotsa music. Get music player. Get spacesuit. Travel to the moon using a spacesuit, thousands of balloons, and a fire extinguisher for navigation. Become King Of The Moon.

Cool.
